channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Revisiting my definition of strategy
item.description: I revisited my definition of strategy several years ago and realized recently that I hadn’t written about it—just presented it privately to executive ...

item.title: Sustainability Is Built Through Collaboration, Not Imposition
item.description: The rush to showcase progress has led many companies to forget they need to co-create solutions with suppliers and communities.

item.title: Here’s Who Can See Your Chat History When You Talk to Each AI
item.description: Here’s a breakdown—by bot—of where your data goes when you talk to Gemini, Perplexity, Claude, and more.

item.title: Nasdaq, Dow, and S&P 500 are all up as threat of government shutdown looms
item.description: Wall Street pushed higher early Monday despite growing anxiety over a possible U.S. government shutdown later this week. Futures for the S&P 500 rose ...

item.title: Mispronouncing Your Own Name—and 22 Other Ways to Build Better Work Culture
item.description: Small acts of service that make things easier, or just plain nicer, go a long way to building and sustaining a strong company culture.

item.title: These 10 Jobs Are the Hardest on Your Feet
item.description: Foot pain may not seem like a big deal, but it can be debilitating and affect your job performance.

item.title: U.S. gold reserves hit $1 trillion in value after record rally
item.description: The Treasury’s gold reserves have surpassed $1 trillion in value, more than 90 times what’s stated on the government’s balance sheet.

item.title: Millions of workers are left out of the ‘low-hire, low-fire’ U.S. job market
item.description: "I don’t wanna use the word begging — but I’m like working a lot. Harder than I thought I would have to secure a position on a senior level.”

item.title: Dealmakers defy stubborn M&A market with rare $1 trillion haul
item.description: Global deal values have topped $1 trillion in a third quarter for only the second time on record, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.

item.title: Women’s Take-Home Pay Often Drops 10 Percent During Menopause, a Study Finds
item.description: Healthcare costs rise as women age, and that can cut into their earnings and even push them out of the workforce.

item.title: Electronic Arts to go private in record $55 billion buyout, the largest in private equity history
item.description: Electronic Arts' stock climbed after they confirmed the private-equity buyout rumors.

item.description: The former deputy attorney general played a key role in several high-profile investigations that directly involved Trump.
